intro: Perityle crassifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved perityle, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features a slender, branching stem with palmate leaves that are broad and lobed. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family.
